definitions.definition: a short, slender, sharp-pointed metal pin with a raised helical thread running around it and a slotted head, used to join things together by being rotated so that it pierces wood or other material and is held tightly in place.
examples: bolt, fastener; Morenail, pin, tack, spike, rivet, brad "stainless steel screws"Morenail, pin, tack, spike, rivet, brad stainless steel screws

definitions.definition: a cylinder with a helical ridge or thread running around the outside (a male screw ) that can be turned to seal an opening, apply pressure, adjust position, etc., especially one fitting into a corresponding internally grooved or threaded piece (a female screw ).
an instrument of torture having the action of a screw.
a ship's or aircraft's propeller (considered as acting like a screw in moving through water or air).
examples: noun: screw propeller; plural noun: screw propellers

definitions.definition: an act of turning a screw or other object having a thread.
examples: turn, twist, wrench the handle needs a couple of screws to tighten it

definitions.definition: another term for draw.
a small twisted-up piece of paper, used as a container for a substance such as salt or tobacco.
a prisoner's derogatory term for a prison guard or warden.
an act of sexual intercourse.
a sexual partner of a specified ability.
an amount of salary or wages.
examples: he's offered me the job with a jolly good screw

definitions.definition: a mean or miserly person.
a worn-out horse.
fasten or tighten with a screw or screws.
examples: screw the hinge to your new door
synonyms: attach "the bracket was screwed in place"

definitions.definition: rotate (something) so as to fit it into or on to a surface or object by means of a spiral thread.
examples: Philip screwed the top on the flask
synonyms: wind "he screwed the lid back on the jar"

definitions.definition: (of an object) be attached or removed by being rotated in this way.
examples: a connector that screws on to the gas cylinder

definitions.definition: turn one's head or body around sharply.
examples: he screwed his head around to try and find the enemy

definitions.definition: cheat or swindle (someone), especially by charging them too much for something.
examples: if you do what they tell you, you're screwed
synonyms: stiff "he realized he had been screwed"

definitions.definition: extort or force something, especially money, from (someone) by putting them under strong pressure.
examples: your grandmother screwed cash out of him for ten years
synonyms: squeeze; informalbleed "she intended to screw money out of them"

definitions.definition: have sexual intercourse with.
(of a couple) have sexual intercourse.
used to express anger or contempt.
another term for draw (sense 8 of the verb).
